task.title: Compile the Action for the Content Definition
task.shortdesc: Compile that actions provided for the content definition.

taskbody.prereq:
The prerequisites to compile that action are:
Create Content definition
Define Actions for the content definition

context.p: Once you compile the actions for the content definition, it will generate Python and JavaScript of the defined actions. The generated Python or JavaScript is applied to the action based on the selected Language for implementing action while creating the action.

After compiling the action, you must author the business logic in the code that is used to run the actions. The action code consists of 3 arguments:
Inputs - contains the information defined while creating the actions.
Output - contains the information defined while creating the actions.
Action Context - contains the details required for action execution. For example, to pass some environment variables to the action.

step.cmd: Select Compile from the drop-down list.
step.stepresult:
The content definition compilation notifications are displayed. Compile Notifications
Compile Notifications

step.cmd: Select Open Source File from the drop-down list.
step.stepresult:
The action source code file is opened. Action in Author Mode
Action in Author Mode

step.cmd: Update the business logic of the action under the pre-run method:

info.pre: ***Implement business logic of action and set outputs

step.info: As an example, we will update the following code:testcontent = inputs.thisContent testcontent.foo = "Hi" outputs.message = "Hello world"
The first two lines defines the business logic and the value that you provide in the outputs.message is the message that you provide after completing the action.
